New Records: Dasun Shanaka hit a fifty off 20 balls, the fastest by a Sri Lankan batsman in the T20 format.
Key Match Events: Dasun Shanaka scored an unbeaten 56 off 22 balls, leading Sri Lanka to 206-6. India was kept down to 190-8 despite a threatening 91-run sixth-wicket stand between Suryakumar Yadav (51) and Axar Patel (65). Shanaka took the series into the decider on Saturday by dismissing Axar and Shivam Mavi in the final over.
Post-Match Reflections: Dasun Shanaka said, "Really good to defend the total, especially against India in these conditions. They took the game away from us but still we managed to hold our nerve." Hardik Pandya said, "In this situation, it's very difficult. In the past as well he's bowled no-balls. It's not about blaming but a no-ball is a crime."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Arshdeep Singh bowled five of the seven no-balls in the innings.
